reviewText: Amusing, brain teasing and vastly entertaining. The series streams beautifully and everyone in my family lives to watch Poirot. Excellent!

reviewText: If you like Agatha Christie, you can't get any better than this series.  Wonderful Poirot. Very true to the character and the stories.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: If you are familiar with the Poirot character from Agatha Christie, You'll agree David Suchet has captured the unique... often quirky style of this crime-solving sleuth. There have been others who've tried, but, only one has mastered the portrayal of Hercule Poirot. If you enjoy 30's era detective stories with a flair for the dramatic... all the nuances of days gone by... and a blend of British, European and Belgian(not French)accents, you're in for a royal treat in Agatha Christie's Poirot with David Suchet.
summary: A Classy Classic Agatha Christie Crime Solver
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: As a long-time fan of Agatha Christie, I decided to go ahead and watch the Poirot series using my Prime membership. I was more than pleasantly surprised by David Suchet in this series! While being meticulous, and a bit prissy, David Suchet actually makes a very likeable Hercule Poirot.This series begins with one of my favorite stories - The Adventure of Clapham Cook - when Hercule is shamed into discovering why a domestic has disappeared!The appropriate settings and timeline are retained in this series, and I found myself looking forward to each new episode. Do start with this Season 1 if you, like me, are just being introduced to this wonderful brought to life series.While there are occasional variations from the original books, the stories are generally true to Agatha's intent.Nicely done!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Poirot is a cerebral, slightly eccentric and charming detective. The stories are set in the 1930's and manage to give the viewer a flavor of the era. The series provides entertainment on the basis of good acting and solid story-lines - without resorting to gratuitous violence or overwhelming special effects. Highly recommended for anyone interested in watching real drama without the hype.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Poirot Series 1 is a great collection of mysteries that give you something to focus on as you follow him and try to pick up the clues he sees.  Each episode is very sharp not only in quality but in the era they present and each has characters that are interesting.  I like watching them not only for the plot but for the costumes and backdrops.  Amazing!

reviewText: I really hate to say this but I have seen every Agatha Christie play, movie, show in any shape or form includingreading all the books..several times..yeah, I know ..sick right..but it's just good stuff and David Suchet is theultimate Poirot..that's it..the best one and there have been many..but he has the goods and I just love it. So if you have never seen it and you love good old fashioned mysterygive it a look see..PS..it is a period pc so there will not be any current wars or government nukes involved.

reviewText: I love Poirot's fastidiousness and his endearing arrogance.  Hercule is always willing to give his "little gray cells" all the time they need to solve the crime.  Poor Hastings - I wonder where his money comes from, taking all those months-long hunting trips, buying cars...but no sign of gainful employment other than being Poirot's side-kick (whom Poirot appreciates more as a friend than a detective).  Like the Miss Marple Series, I watch these over and over.

reviewText: I've watched every Hercule Poirot rendition by David Suchet, and I find them all extremely fun to watch.At times, though, the insinuation of homosexuality and religious fervor on the part of Poirot are both unnecessary and not at all what Agatha Christie would espouse.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Hercule Poirot: a consummate gentleman, an elegant dresser; witty, wise, fastidious and at times immensely charming.  Yet he can also be arrogant and overbearing.  If you've read Ms Christie's novels and enjoyed them, it's reasonable to think you will enjoy David Suchet's embodiment of the character.  In my opinion Mr. Suchet's portrayal is impeccable.  If you're not familiar with Agatha Christie's writing/the character of Hercule Poirot, please be advised these are intelligently written mysteries, set in the beginning of the 20th century and sans sensationalism, gore or other accoutrements of modern detective/mystery television.  The humor is very dry, the pace is sedate and there are no laugh tracks.  This series is more like something you'd see on Masterpiece Theater.  In addition to Mr. Suchet's excellent characterization, I also think that the supporting actor's interpretation of their characters are excellent.  The sets and scenery are also very nicely represented, in [usually] sumptuous interiors and surroundings amidst the gorgeous grounds of the English countryside.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I just started watching the series.  I love it.  I am on season 4.  This reminds me of a great detective novels that I love to read.  His accent is great.  The series is a winner.

reviewText: The late 1930s period costumes as accurate as the Art Deco sets. David Suchet begins his masterful role as Hercule Poirot with the supporting cast of associate Hastings (Hugh Fraser-`The Bretts'); CI Japp (Philip Jackson-`Robin of Sherwood'); and Sec. Lemon (Pauline Moran).Any POIROT set is just plain GOOD murder mystery. Agatha Christie suspense perfect. David Suchet acting excellence. Combined they make any British Mystery viewer salivate. Add top guest stars in each and kick in some of the best filmed period mystery ever produced. It's what fans have come to expect with Poirot, Agatha Christie, Masterpiece Mystery, and the untouchable as Hercule Poirot--David Suchet.The Blu-rays and new DVDs are SUBTITLED, newly remastered and restored to their original U.K. broadcast order. This is wonderful mystery TV, never to get out of date. You WILL love every feature-length episode.3 THE ADVENTURE OF JOHNNIE WAVERLY: Waverly's (Goeffrey Bateman) wealthy wife Ada (Julia Chambers) wants Poirot's help when kidnap threats reach a peak.
summary: Waverly child's mishap is no problem for Poirot

reviewText: Agatha Christie's family asked Suchet to play Poirot.  Many accomplished actors have portrayed Poirot, but none captured the personality traits of the character the way David Suchet has.  The mincing steps, scrupulous attention to cleanliness and other minutia bring this quirky Belgian detective to life.  I feel like I know him.

reviewText: The acting, the cast, and the ambiance all get 5 stars. Set designer gets 6! Everything, ...everything is period appropriate. Not just the cars..those are never 'right' and always, even here, are too obviously restored. It's the furnishings that will knock your eye out. In the offices, apartments, entryways, wherever Poirot moves we're treated to a deco that's magnificent. Hairstyles, fashions, accessories, paraphernalia of every sort is just so.

reviewerName: Konrei "Everything I need is right here"
reviewText: Hercule Poirot, the diminutive Belgian detective of Agatha Christie's imagining, is brilliantly brought to life by British actor David Suchet. Suchet, who was chosen for the role by the executors of Christie's estate, turns in a characterization that is now universally considered the non plus ultra of  all Poirots of the silver screen, large or small.Since 1989, Suchet has worked steadily to bring all the Poirot stories (33 novels, one play and 50 + short stories) to life, and by 2013 will have accomplished this impressive task.The earlier seasons are framed in the Art Deco 1930s, a period which is meticulously recreated onscreen. The series abounds with droll humor, generated largely by Poirot's insufferable self-esteem garnished with his freely flowing malapropisms. His foils include Captain Hastings, the Dr. John Watson of Poirot's universe, Chief Inspector Japp, the disheveled LeStrade, and Miss Lemon, Poirot's Obsessive-Compulsive secretary. Hastings tends to go off on tangents (frequently about motorcars), Japp is always three steps behind Poirot, and Miss Lemon keeps the office running smoothly, giving Poirot's "little grey cells" ample opportunity to unravel the Gordian Knots of cases that cross his desk.The show has a slower and more methodical pace than most American television, and the mysteries are more softboiled, with an absence of the lurid violence we've come to expect on TV. Anyone turning to POIROT for an adrenaline rush will be put to sleep. But if you enjoy low-key period mystery stories, this show simply cannot be surpassed!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: David Suchet is the ultimate Poirot-keen observer combined with vanity, with just a dab of humor. Episodes provide just enough clues to tantalize.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Next to Sherlock Holmes(jeremy Brett) Hercule is the best detective in the world. He is absolutely is my very favorite.!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: Very good series. Well written and acted. The art deco background and authenticity are great. Suchet and cast are superb. I think only in Britain do you find the depth and class of actors you find here.

reviewText: I had not seen this series before and I just love it.  Love HP and his solving of the crimes.  The mustache is a bit much but it fits the character.  Looking forward to the rest of the years of this series.

reviewText: I really enjoy Poirot, because he Always solves the case. Plus, there is some good humor in the midst of tragedy.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: There is absolutely no argument that David Suchet characterizes the Christie detective, Hercule Poirot. This small fastidious Belguique works with "the little grey cells" to solve murder mysteries. Some of the murders are solved in a sketchy manner where all the clues are presented but they are tied together in a hasty and often critically questionable manner. Still, all in all, a fine series that saw many years in production because of the quality of filming and acting by the crew. I enjoy the series.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: This is a great series.  I have watched them many times with pleasure.  David Suchet is Poirot.  Although the series does not follow Agathe Christi's character exactly it is very entertaining.  The added characters of Miss Lemon as his secretary and Captain Hastings as a sidekick adds to the theme.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Love the 'little gray cell master'. No one portrays Poirot as well as David Suchet. I've seen a few, and they don't compare...so glad there are so many seasons and episodes.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: These presentations starring David Suchet are beautifully done and as many have said, Mr Suchet is the definitive Poirot.  Being a reader more than a watcher, I make it a point to look at each film as it's own story rather than compare it to the stories on which they are loosely based.
summary: Not always true to Dame Agatha
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: We just started watching this series through my Kindle Fire.  It is definitely English and Agatha Christie.  Poirot is just like the character I imagine in the books.  The plot has lots of twists and turns and is fun to try to figure out.  The old cars and thirties background is fascinating.  This is a great series for any mystery fan who enjoys English "crime stories."
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Simply The Best with a high bar others should and might aspire to with Poirot perfect in his role and the location scenery, intoxicating and vibrant

reviewText: David Suchet has the voice and the acting to bring this character to life like no one else could.  You will love this trying to figure out who done it.  Well done and well acted you will enjoy spending some time in a book come to life.

Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I am actually watching this series in order after having watched much of Poirot on PBS whenever it was aired. I can't tell you how many times I've watched any specific episode, but I can tell you that I never tire of David Suchet's performance. His portrayal of the fussy little Belgian with the mighty little gray cells is just a bit of perfection to watch.Although, I have never been a fan of Agatha Christie's writing, this character is both Sherlockian in his abilities and quite personable in his interactions with his clients and the inimitable Miss Lemon and the somewhat bumbling Captain Hastings. If you enjoy a mystery and the trappings of the Art Deco era, Poirot is for you!
summary: David Suchet Is a Perfect Poirot
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: David Suchet and troops are the epitome of excellent Agatha Christie's Hercule Poirot--a little humor, a little horror, and excellent characterization done by all!  It doesn't get any better than this.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I have always like the books and David Suchet is so charming.  Would recommend it to everyone.  Plan to watch more of the same.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Excellent series, with superb acting! I love Hercules Poirot with his "little gray cells", his meticulous appearance and endearing vanity. David Suchet has filled the patent leather shoes of Hercules Poirot so well, that all other actors who endeavor to play this role will inevitably be compared to him. Simply marvelous! :-)
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I was not a fan of mysteries until I started reading the Brother Cadfael novels by Ellis Peters and watched the adaptations on PBS Masterpiece Theater.  I then tried watching a couple of episodes of Agatha Christie's Hercule Poirot on PBS Mystsery and became hooked on David Suchet's portrayal of the Belgian private detective.  The portrayals of Captain Hastings, Miss Lemon, and Chief Inspector Japp are of similar high quality; a wonderful ensemble.  The continuity of the ITV adaptations seems as near perfect as possible.  (NOTE: I have not read any of Agatha Christie's mysteries; I have just watched the ITV adaptations.)
summary: Excellent Portrayals of Agatha Christie's Characters
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Another Agatha Chrisie's great series of "who-done-it"? I enjoy almost any of the episodes. Poirot's character is caresmatic and insightful. He reminds me a bit of Sherlock Holmes. I recommend the series.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: These first Poirots feature a slimmer and somewhat less acerbic Poirot than we see in later episodes.  Miss Lemon and Captain Hastings are wonderful and their presence makes a very amusing ensemble.  The stories feature many other fine character actors as well.  Highly recommend.
summary: Wonderful early episodes with lots of period detail
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I enjoy the Poirot Series for the time period it is set in, and he is involved in differend kinds of cases.

reviewText: David Suchet is the best Poirot ever.  These are great videos and stories; however, Acorn Media really needs to start including closed captioning or subtitles.  My wife, who is nearly totally deaf, likes the A&E versions because they include closed captioning.  When we watch Acorn Media, I have to stop, explain what's going on and then continue on.

reviewText: Love UK sense of entertainment great show(s).....

reviewText: Wonderful casting and terrific recreation of the 30s look and feel.  Characters are in the early stages of development but are still well done.  I believe the later series are even better done with the real villain better disguised.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Next to Sherlock Holmes, Hercule Poirot has to be the other most popular detective series ever.  It's my understanding that author Agatha Christie's family explicitly recommended David Suchet for the role of Hercule Poirot, and I cannot imagine anyone else playing the part any better.  Always entertaining, I highly recommend this series to anyone interested in good mystery stories.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: We all watch with interest in how the mystery unfolds. But I have never gripped my armchair in sympathy for any victim, hero; nor was I ever tempted to hiss nor boo the villains. Worth watching, though
summary: Doesn't fail to tell a good story, but never hits a "home run"

reviewText: David Suchet is brilliant. The cast is perfect. The plot twists are always engrossing. The production values are top shelf and beautifully shot. What else could you possibly want?

reviewText: When nothing else appeases my viewing pleasure I can always count on Poirot to fill that void. I'm sure I've watched every last series he's every made. 5 stars in my book

reviewText: A prissy little man with a sly look and a twinkle in his eyes who sees more than anyone else around him.  He solves the mystery in his head long before you decide there is a mystery.  I resisted forever to watch the series but once I started it had me hooked.  Love all the supporting cast, secretary(quirky), assistant(so English), Scotland Yard cop(by the book).  The settings for the shows are great.  Old mansions, seaside villas, old trains, ships.  I love it all.
summary: A detective different than all others

reviewText: Being able to watch this entire series is wonderful. It's been so many years since I've seen these that I don't remember whodonit so it's like all new episodes to me!

I highly recommend these films and episodes to anyone who likes a cozy mystery with great actors and great scenery, enjoy!

reviewText: I've watched the first five seasons of this series and enjoyed them. David Suchet is superb as Poirot. The supporting cast is invariably very good, the settings are interesting, the vintage vehicles are spectacular, and production values are high. Why, then, only three stars? The answer is, the Agatha Christie style of mystery story, for me at least, is an acquired taste; one I have yet to fully acquire. (I've watched a number of dramatizations of Miss Marple stories - featuring three different actresses - and found the basic story structure to be the same.) The stories feature an introductory portion, in which we are acquainted with the setting and characters; then a murder occurs, before or after which several of the characters are shown to have motives that could make any one of them the killer; Poirot asks many questions, often indicating with a smug smile that an answer has provided insight. Then the ending, the hallmark of Christie's stories, when, in this series, Poirot gathers the suspects together, dissects the mystery for their and our benefit, and reveals the culprit, who, invariably, is present and is not the person the setup pointed to, and who, more often than not, grudgingly admits to the crime and offers a justification for it, before being hauled away with a minimum of unpleasantness. The staging of these stories, especially of the endings, tends to be rather theatrical. And too often how the murderer accomplished his or her crime is so elaborate as to be implausible. These aspects were intrusive reminders that I was watching a performance, not eavesdropping on real people. Still, the stories are enjoyable if not memorable. David Suchet's performance, on the other hand, is both enjoyable and memorable.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: The  stories of Agatha Christies stories and Suchets acting are great. He really puts his heart and soul into the character.

reviewText: My wife and I are now on Season 3, and Poirot just gets better.Of course, we enjoy the absolute elegance of costumes, homes, settings and characters.Of course, the mysteries are difficult to puzzle out, though there is sometimes the joy of a correct guess.One of my favorite elements is the humor, which sometimes make me laugh out loud. Poirot expresses a dryly sarcastic vein of observations which are hilarious.
summary: We are hooked on the Poirot mystery series! :-)
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: This is a British made series, with a great company of actors. The production and scripts originating from the great Mystery  author Agatha Christy.  The series tell us about  Hercule Poirot and his associate  Captain Hastings investigating criminal mysteries, both helped in their endeavors by Chief Inspector Japp of Scotland Yard. This is the first of 14 Series, the British really know how to make these Mystery shows work and are better than anybody else at it. This is my personal opinion not wishing to upset any reader of my comments. Family viewing in the main and well worth the time to watch this series, you I am sure will enjoy. Highly recommended
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: When you love mysteries, murder without blood and certainly no violence, this is the one to watch.For the younger viewers probably a little to old-fashioned but I love it!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I'm g;ad that there are older series/movies on AOL Prime. Some are old favorites that I watched years ago, others I have never seen.Guess I'm showing my age, but I find much of what is currently available, especially new movies, a bit too 'graphic' for my tastes. While I can appreciate newer shows for their up-to-date tech, I don't find them very interesting or relaxing to watch. And that's why I watch!!!! Shows like this one are my 'cup of tea'. I intend to watch all of the seasons and enjoy Poirot'sclever solutions. The episodes are all entertaining.

reviewText: To me, David Suchet is the all time best Poirot and I really enjoyed series 1. You get stories that challenge you to solve them as well as being returned to the 30's time frame.

reviewText: Hercule Poirot is the super sleuth, always using his "little gray cells" to solve the case.  David Suchet plays the part just the way Agatha Christie planned.  He's quirky, odd, impeccable in his dress (not to mention his mustache) & always, always finds the murderer.  Watching him find clues in the most minute detail is quite interesting.  And then there's his associate, Captain Hastings & his secretary, Miss Limon, providing entertaining additions to the mix.  Overall, an very intriguing and fun series to watch.  I highly recommend it to mystery lovers & fans of Agatha Christie.  Well done!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: This is good stuff.  Lighter entertainment but nonetheless engrossing enough to want to follow.  There is just something about British produced procedurals that makes them better than most others.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: Our family has recently started viewing these.  The mysteries are engaging and the characters are well-defined.  The humor is swift and understated--no laugh track needed to make you smile.  Kid-safe (our 11 and 13 year olds enjoy the series).
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: It has been a few years since I have watched these programs and I still enjoy them. It has been long enough so that I do not remember them all.

reviewText: David Suchet's Poirot could very well be the character pulled from one of Agatha Christie's books and transferred to the small screen.  I have every episode and movie and will watch different ones from time to time and never tire of the quality of the characters, the acting, the directing and the producing.All of the Poirot series are top of the line, pure quality.

reviewText: The story lines are awesome, the actors superb. What more can I say?! Take the time to watch these; you won't regret it.

reviewText: I love British mysteries.  The script(s) are good, the actors are good.  Everything about the presentation is straight forward.  If one can get past Poirot's contrived accent, etc,.he manages to tie everything together in the last few minutes.The  settings are as authentic as possible, old mansions and such. A pleasure to watch.

reviewText: What is left to say, I love the little froggie as they say. Well worth the watch. don't miss it.

reviewText: If you like a well acted mystery during the art deco period this series is for you.  Hercules Poirot by David Suchet via Agatha Christie is a delight.

reviewText: I loved the Pirot series on pbs a few years ago.  But since then, my hearing  has gotten bad.  The video does not have subtitles, and I miss understanding a great deal of the dialogue.  That was a disappointment to me. That aside, I love David Suchet and the story.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I can't say enough good things about David Suchet playing the enigmatic Hercule Poirot.  Indeed I cannot think of any other actor that would be able to play that character as convincingly as Mr. Suchet did.  That was a marvelous pairing of character and actor.  That said, if you like Agatha Christie's books, you'll enjoy watching this series.  It was great to see it again.  It has been along while since Poirot was shown on PBS stations and I was very delighted to see it offered on Amazon.  I was also tickled to death to note that it was designated as a Prime series that I could watch for free.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: I love this series.  I watched them when they were on Masterpiece Theatre and am loving them all over again now that they are available on Amazon Prime. I am a murder mystery nut and Masterpiece Theatre has some of the best.David Suchet is wonderful as Poirot and the supporting cast is great.  All the characters are well written and the stories are just great. Do yourself a favor, brew up a cup of tea or coffee, put your feet up and watch an episode, you'll be hooked the very first time you watch one.
summary: The little gray cells are back!!
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1

reviewText: British television is so far ahead of American TV that I'm afraid we'll never catch up. This series is just one example of England's excellent entertainment produce. David Suchet is the quintessential Hercule Poirot, he leaves all other portrayers in the dust. The locales, sets and automobiles all, set the exact tone of the period. Who doesn't love a good mystery? If there were ten stars I would mark them. That's how good these episodes are.
Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Movie Collection, Set 1
